results.title: Operation eastbound
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force and Harry Rayner
results.brief_description: RAAF jets circle the world in four weeks. Flying from Amberley, Queensland, to refuel in Fiji; seeing the color of Hawaii and its war cemetry. Air force bases in California, Bermuda, Malta are visited on the journey to Lagos, Nigeria, where colorful Independence celebrations attended by Princess Alexandra take place. After a week the men fly home buying gifts at Aden, seeing palm trees at Cocos Islands, passing over Perth in formation, and back to Amberley.

results.title: Operation dumbo drop
results.creator_credit: Interscope communications, Diane Nabatoff, David Madden and Simon Wincer
results.brief_description: A jumbo-sized hit comedy. A seasoned army captain is teamed with a hard-nosed officer to conduct the “biggest” military manoeuvre ever - to secretly transport a full-grown elephant to a remote and nearly inaccessible jungle village. By land, sea and air, calamity and chaos prevail upon their hilariously mismatched team of would-be heroes. But with a little luck…and tons of hard work…they learn that no mission is impossible. Cast includes Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary.

results.title: Operation Barbarossa
results.creator_credit: Peter Batty Productions and Peter Batty
results.brief_description: It was the biggest, bloodiest, bitterest battle ever fought. It cost the lives of at least 20 million people and ended Europe’s dominance in world affairs. It was the head-on clash of the two mightiest armies Man has ever known - and in sheer numbers, miles of front, and quantity of guns and shells and tanks, no other battle in history can compare with it. Unique archival material is combined with notable contributions from some of the participants, such as Albert Speer to document Hitler’s doomed attempt to subdue Russia.

results.title: Operation Bala Lagin
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force and Stanley Brogden
results.brief_description: During 1956, a squadron of Australian built Canberra Jet Bombers visited the United States on a good-will mission. In the United States the airmen took part in the armed forces day parade in Washington, saw a demonstration of American aircraft, including the latest highspeed planes and jet bombers; visited Randolph Field, the USAF Medical Center, and took part in an annual ceremony commemorating the first flight across the Pacific by Kingsford-Smith and Ulm.

results.title: Operation and care of the Victor projector
results.brief_description: Explains by use of close-up photography the construction, threading, operation and care of the Victor 16 millimetre sound projector. Illustrates correct procedures for cleaning and lubricating the projector.

results.title: Operation and care of the Bell and Howell projector
results.brief_description: Close-ups show how to thread and operate the Bell and Howell 16 millimetre sound projector. Also shown is the correct method for setting up the equipment. Stresses the importance of proper maintenance and care. Bell and Howell Filmosound models 179 and 185 are used in the demonstration.

results.title: Operation Adaminaby
results.creator_credit: Snowy Mountains Hydro-Electric Authority and H Malcolm
results.brief_description: Details the moving of the township of Adaminaby from its old site, soon to be flooded by the rising waters of Lake Eucumbene, to a new location six miles away. The building of the huge Adaminaby dam across the Eucumbene River to form Lake Eucumbene, the heart of the scheme, faced the Authority with the choice of either buying out the residents or moving their town. After consultation a new town was laid out and the houses moved, at times under unusually difficult conditions. Historic churches were demolished and reconstructed; a new shopping centre built; trees planted and a garden competition organised. Within two years the entire town was re-established, the diversion tunnel closed and the water began to rise over the old town.

results.title: Operating under pressure
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Films (Australia), Victorian Pipelines Commission and John Richardson
results.brief_description: Construction of the 108-mile pipeline conveying natural gas from Dutson to Dandenong, Victoria. Shows manufacture, welding, testing and laying pipes, discussing problems encountered, and the final turning on of gas.
